title: 5 Quick Steps to Delete an App on Samsung TV's Smart Hub

steps.title: On the remote, press the "home" button.
steps.content: On the remote, press the "home" button. This is the house icon at the center of your remote. If your TV isn't already on, turn it on first. [1] X Research source The home menu will open. Certain apps—such as Netflix and Amazon Prime Video —come preinstalled on Samsung Smart TVs. These apps cannot be uninstalled.

steps.title: Select the app you want to delete.
steps.content: Select the app you want to delete. Use the remote to navigate to the app. When it's selected, the app should appear bigger than the others.

steps.title: On the remote, press the down arrow.
steps.content: On the remote, press the down arrow. This will open the app's options.

steps.title: Select Remove and press the "Enter" button.
steps.content: Select Remove and press the "Enter" button. The Enter button is the center button between the four directional arrows.

steps.title: Select Remove.
steps.content: Select Remove . This will confirm your decision to delete the app. Deleting apps is a great way to clear up space on your Samsung TV. You can also clear the cache routinely to keep it working properly. If needed, you always download the apps again later.
